alert.note: Alert for Kingsbury (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 10 at 7:21PM MDT until August 10 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN KINGSBURY COUNTY... At 820 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located over Badger, or 8 miles southwest of Lake Poinsett, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Emergency management confirmed tornado. At 8:18 pm, the Kingbury emergency manager reported a tornado between Badger and Erwin. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Kingsbury County. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
